summary: An ordinance appropriating the sum of $500.00 out of the General Fund of the City of Seattle, to pay the claim of Mrs. M. A. Rice, commonly known as Mrs. M. A. Evetts, for personal injuries received while on a defective sidewalk on the south side of Mead Street between 46th and 48th Streets, on the 3rd day of January, 1912, and authorizing the drawing of a warrant therefor, and declaring an emergency.
